さて、買い物も済ませたし、帰るとするか……: Now that we're done shopping, let's head home...
（ん？ なんだ？ あそこで誰か揉めているぞ）: (Hm? What is it? Someone's arguing over there.)
だから、親の躾けがなってないって言ったんだよ。\nあんたのせいで、あたしゃ転んだ:
That's why I said my parents weren't disciplined.
It's your fault I fell over.
そのことは、さっきから何度も謝ってるでしょ！\nおまえこそ、しつこいんじゃないの:
I've been apologizing to you over and over for that!
Aren't you the one who's persistent!?
（あれはラミか？ 揉めているようだが……何が起きてるんだ？）: (Is that a Rami? They seem to be arguing... What's going on?)
なんだい、その言い草は！？\nそれが人様に迷惑をかけて言うことかい？:
What's with the way you're talking?!
Is that what you mean by causing trouble for others?
ラミはただ、ティッシュを配ってただけだし！: Rami was just handing out tissues!
あんたが突然声かけてきたせいで、あたしは滑って転んだのよ。\n危うく大怪我すると:
I slipped and fell because you suddenly called out to me.
You almost got hurt, didn't you?
そっちだって、こんな人混みの真ん中を大きな荷物を持って、\n堂々と歩いて他の人に:
Even over there, in the middle of a crowd like this, carrying a large piece of luggage
You were walking boldly and causing trouble for other people!
それが年上に対しての口の利き方かい。\nもう許せない！ 土下座して謝罪しなさいよ:
Is that how you talk to older people?
I can't forgive you anymore! Get down on your hands and knees and apologize!
はあ？ 土下座！？: Huh? On your hands and knees?!
ばっかじゃないの！？ そんなのするわけないじゃん！: Are you stupid?! There's no way I'd do that!
じゃあ、あんたを訴えるけど！？\n多額の慰謝料を払って泣くのはそっちだから！:
Then I'll sue you!?
You're the one who's going to pay a lot of alimony and cry!
は……？ 訴えるって……そこまでする！？: Huh...? Sue me...? You're going that far!?
はっ！ あんた、貧乏そうだもんね！\n慰謝料なんて払えないでしょう？:
Hah! You look like you're poor!
You can't pay a consolation fee, can you?
こいつも謝ってるんだし、この辺で勘弁してもらえませんか？: He's apologizing, too, so could you spare him around here?
なんだい、知り合いかい！？ ふざけんじゃないよ。\nあたしゃ、その子が土下座する:
What, you know him?! Don't be ridiculous.
I won't forgive her until she gets down on her hands and knees!
こうして揉めていても埒が明かないですし、\nとりあえず風紀委員会でも呼びましょう:
We're not getting anywhere arguing like this,
Should I call the disciplinary committee or something?
この学園の風紀委員会は、ただの学生の集まりではない。\n学園外の警察とほぼ同じ役:
This school's disciplinary committee was no ordinary gathering of students.
It's a legitimate public security organization with almost the same role and power as the police outside the school.
彼女達が間に入れば、冷静に会話もできるでしょう。\nまさか呼ばれて困る不都合なん:
If they get between us, we'll be able to have a calm conversation.
There's no way it'd be inconvenient for her to call me that...right?
ああ、ちなみに相手を畏怖させるのが目的で『訴える』は、\n下手すりゃ犯罪ですよ。:
Oh, and by the way, " sue" for the sake of scaring the other person is...
If you're not careful, it's a crime. The same goes for prostrating yourself before me.
わ、わかったわよ！ 今日はこれくらいで勘弁してあげるわ！\nもう二度とあたしの前:
A-All right! I'll give you a break for today!
Please don't ever appear before me again!
いーだ！ こっちこそ願い下げだっつの！\n二度とラミの前に現れるな！:
It's fine! I'm the one who's begging you!
Never appear before Rami again!
おい、そこまでにしておけ。一体何があったんだよ？: Hey, leave it at that. What the hell happened?
どうもこうもないっつの。ティッシュ配りのバイトしてたら、\nあのおばさんがすっ転:
It's nothing. I was working part-time to hand out tissues, and...
That old lady just tripped and flirted with me.
……ほら、そこにお菓子屋さんがあるでしょ？: ...Look, there's a candy store over there, right?
あそこに小さな子がいっぱいかたまってて、\nぶつかったら危ないし、注意しようと思:
There were a lot of little kids piled up over there,
It'd be dangerous if we bumped into each other, so I called out to her to be careful.
そしたら振り向くと同時に、\n荷物に振り回されたのか……滑ってズデーン。:
Then I turned around, and at the same time...
She must have been thrown around by the luggage... She slipped.
……なるほど、そういうわけだったのか。\nむやみやたらに喧嘩を買ってたわけじゃな:
...I see. So that's why.
I guess she wasn't trying to pick a fight.
ラミはそこまでヒマじゃないし！: Rami doesn't have that much free time!
でも、小さな子を助けるくらいにはヒマだったんだな？: But you had enough free time to save a little girl, didn't you?
ち、違うって！\nただ、目についたから……うぅぅぅーっ！:
N-No, that's not it!
But it caught my eye... Uuuu!
まあ、大きな問題にならなくてよかったよ。: Well, I'm glad it didn't become a big problem.
ふん、おまえの助けがなくても、ラミひとりでなんとかできたわ。: Hmph. Even without your help, Rami could have handled it on her own.
やれやれ、相変わらずだな。: Man, she's the same as ever.
さっきの騒ぎ、見てたわ。\nまた揉めてたみたいね。これで何度目？:
I saw the commotion earlier.
Looks like they were arguing again. How many times has this happened?
は？ 店長見てたの！？ なら、ラミが悪くないって知ってるよね！？\nというか、な:
Huh? You were watching the manager?! Then you know Rami's not bad, right?!
Wait, why was it just the "only" I'd been watching?!
そういう問題じゃないわ。\nあなたが揉めると、うちの店が迷惑をこうむるの。:
That's not the problem.
If you get into a fight, it'll cause trouble for our store.
あなたみたいにトラブルばかり起こす子を\nいつまでも雇うわけにはいかないわ。:
A girl like you who causes nothing but trouble.
I can't hire you forever.
つまり、ラミはクビって……こと？: In other words, Rami is... fired?
残念だけど、そういうことになるわね。: I'm sorry, but that's how it is.
クビにするのはいいけど、\n働いた分はちゃんと払ってよ！:
It's fine to fire her, but...
Make sure you pay for your work!
わざわざ言わなくても払うわよ。本当お金にうるさいわね。\n面接のときも時給や支払:
You don't have to tell me. I'll pay you. You really are fussy about money.
We were always talking about the hourly wages and payment dates during interviews, too.
働くなら最初にお金の話するのは当然でしょ！\n非正規にそれ以外求めんな！:
If you're going to work, it's only natural that you'd talk about money first!
Don't ask for anything else!
%usernameusernameuserna%も、いつまで突っ立ってんの？\n:
How long are you going to stand there, %usernameusernameuserna%?
Let's get going.
なあ、バイトの件はいいのか？\nちゃんと説明したら、わかってくれたんじゃないのか:
Hey, are you okay with the part-time job?
Wouldn't she understand if I explained it to her properly?
ふん、あの店長もムカついていたんだよね。問題起こっても\n見てるだけのくせに、あ:
Hmph, that manager was pissed off too, wasn't he? Even if there was a problem
Even though she's just watching, she talks a lot when she blames me later.
どっちみち近いうちに辞めようと思ってたんだよ。\nまあ、いいチャンスだったわ。:
Either way, I was thinking of quitting soon.
Well, this was a good chance.
あーあ、またクビになっちゃった。\n明日から新しいバイトを探さなくちゃ。:
Aww, I got fired again.
I have to find a new part-time job starting tomorrow.
さっきも言ってたが、『また』って……結構クビになってるのか？: Like you said earlier, 'again'......is she pretty fired?
はあ？ そこまででもないけど？\nコンビニ、スーパー、レストラン……今回のティッ:
Huh? It's not that bad, though.
Convenience stores, supermarkets, restaurants... This time, we're handing out tissues.
……十分だろ。なんでそんなにクビになったんだ？: ...That should be enough. Why did you get fired so badly?
今日と同じだけど？ 客や偉い人と喧嘩しただけ。: It's the same as today. I just had a fight with a guest or someone important.
何！？ なんか文句ある！？: What!? Do you have a problem with that!?
……なあ、働くなら、少しは我慢も必要じゃないのか？: ...Hey, if you're going to work, don't you need to put up with it a little?
仕方ないじゃん！ あんな偉そうな態度を取られて、\n舐められたら、反論したくなる:
I can't help it! She's acting so high and mighty
If she licks you, you'll want to argue!
……気持ちはわかるが、仕事には理不尽がつきものだ。\nすぐに揉めてたら、どんな仕:
...I understand how she feels, but there's a sense of unfairness in her work.
If we got into a fight right away, we wouldn't be able to do any work, would we?
うっさい！ 余計なお世話！\n舐められるのだけは、我慢ならないの！:
Shut up! That's none of your business!
I can't stand being licked!
つか、次の仕事どうすっかなー。\nメイズ探索だけじゃいまいち足りないし……:
Anyway, what should I do about my next job?
Searching for Maze isn't going to be enough...
そりゃいろいろあるんだよ！\n仕送りとか……:
Of course there's a lot going on!
Sending money...
な、なんでもない！\nとにかく、ラミはいろいろ使うから、お金がほしいの！:
N-Nothing!
Anyway, Rami spends a lot of money, so I want money!
まさか、%usernameusernameuserna%が\nお金恵んでくれると:
No way, %usernameusernameuserna% thought
You'll give me money?!
言ってみただけだっつの。\n……それで、方法って？:
I was just trying to say it.
...So, what's the method?
……お前の仕事の愚痴は、俺が全部聞いてやる。: ...I'll listen to all your complaints about your work.
今まで客や上司にイライラしたら、そのまま相手にぶつけてたんだろ？: If you've been irritated by customers or bosses up until now, you'd just hit them, right?
だったらこれからは、そのイライラを俺が全部引き受けてやる。\nその代わり、せめて:
In that case, from now on, I'll take on all of that irritation.
In exchange, at least put up with it while you're working.
それって……ラミが仕事を続けるために、\n%usernameusernameus:
That means... Rami has to keep working.
Are you saying %usernameusernameuserna% will be the outlet?
ばっかじゃないの？ ラミの愚痴をぶつけられても、\n%usernameusern:
Aren't you an idiot? Even if you vent about Rami,
There's nothing to gain from %usernameusernameuserna%!
あ、わかった！ ラミに貸しを作りたいわけ？\n貸しをつくって、ラミに言うことを聞:
Oh, I get it! You want to owe Rami a favor?
Like, "I'll make you owe me, and I'll listen to you, Rami!"
そんなつもりはない。\n俺はただ仲間として、ラミの力になりたいだけだ。:
That wasn't my intention.
I just want to help Rami as a comrade.
ああ、仲間なら困った時は、力を貸すもんだろ？: Yeah, if we're friends, we'll lend you our strength when you're in trouble, right?
めるや他の連中だって、ラミが頼めばきっと力になってくれるぞ。\n愚痴くらい聞いて:
If Rami asks, I'm sure the others will help.
At least listen to my complaints.
……だ、大事な仲間にそんなダルいムーブするわけないでしょ。\nはけ口にするなら%:
...Th-There's no way I'd make such a lame move with my precious friends.
If you're going to use it as an outlet, %usernameusernameuserna% is good enough.
おいおい、俺は『大事な』には、入らないのか？: Hey, hey, don't you think I'm important?
まさか入ると思ってたの～？ ウケる～！\nまあ、片足くらいは突っ込んでんじゃない:
Did you think I'd come in? That's hilarious!
Well, I'm sure he's got at least one leg in him.
つか、マジでラミの愚痴のはけ口になってくれるんだよね？\nあとからやっぱやーめた:
You're really going to be the outlet for Rami's complaints, aren't you?
Don't tell me you quit after all, okay?
ああ、男に二言はない。好きなだけ付き合うぞ。: Yeah, men don't go back on their word. I'll go along with you as much as you want.
にひひ、言質取～った！\nラミが満足するまで付き合ってもらうから、覚悟しなさい！:
Nihihi, I got your word!
I'll have you stay with me until Rami's satisfied, so prepare yourself!
それでさ、今度のバイト先の店長ったら説教が長いのなんの……\nラミがちょっとミス:
So, the manager at my new part-time job's been lectured for a long time...
Rami just made a small mistake and lectured me about it.
ねえ、ちょっとー、ラミの話ちゃんと聞いてんの？: Hey, hey, are you listening to Rami?
あれからほぼ毎日のようにラミに呼び出されてるが――: I've been summoned by Rami almost every day since then, but—
んで、他にも副店長がまためんどくさいやつでさ！\nラミが可愛いからって嫉妬しちゃ:
And the second-in-command is another pain in the ass!
I got jealous just because Rami was cute...
ああ、そうだ。\nそれ以外にもこないだ、コンビニでさぁ――:
Yeah, that's right.
Other than that, at the convenience store the other day...
な、なあ、よくそんなに出てくるな……\nもう５時間も話してるぞ……:
H-Hey, I'm surprised there's so much coming out...
We've been talking for five hours...
はあ？ 『もう』じゃなくて、『たった』５時間っしょ！\nまだまだこれからだっつの:
Huh? It's not 'already', it's 'only' five hours!
We still have a long way to go!
あれ？ もしかしてぇ～、もうバテたの～？\n愚痴を聞くって言ったのはそっちのくせ:
Huh? Could it be that you're already exhausted?
You're the one who said you'd listen to my complaints!
男に二言はないって言ったくせに、マジよわよわじゃーん！\nやーい、ざーこざーこ！:
You said men don't go back on their word, but you're seriously waaaaay!
Yay, that's rough!
（なんか無性に腹立たしいな……！ でも言い出しっぺな手前、\n何も言い返せない…:
(This is really irritating...! But I'm on the verge of saying it...
There's nothing I can say in response...!)
%usernameusernameuserna%のおかげで、\n今のレジ打ちのバ:
Thanks to %usernameusernameuserna%,
I'm still working part-time at the register.
だってー、腹が立つことも、全部おまえに話すネタだって思ったら、\nなんだか怒られ:
I mean, when I think about how irritating it is and how it's all a story to tell you,
For some reason, I don't really mind getting yelled at anymore.
はは……じゃあ、ちゃんと俺のこの苦労も報われてるってわけか。: Haha... So my hardships are paying off.
つーわけで！ ラミがこれからもいーっぱい稼ぎ続けるために、\nおまえにはずーっと:
And so! In order for Rami to keep making lots of money from now on,
I'm going to have you come with me all the time!
ったく……仕方ないな。まあ、男に二言はないって言ったしな。\nこうなったら、とこ:
Geez... I guess it can't be helped. Well, I did say that men don't go back on their word.
Now that it's come to this, I'll go all out with you.
トーゼンじゃない！\nこれからもよろしくね♪:
It's not Tosen!
I'll be counting on you from now on♪
